intro: Lotononis elongata, commonly known as the slender lotonon, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Lotononis elongata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained conditions.
